result.execSummary:
All charges against Edward Charles Topple in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward Charles Topple is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for return of firearm, signed and filed
Regarding Return of Firearms, signed and filed

Defendant Edward Charles Topple in court. Intern Emily Ward under the student practice rules supervised by Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the City of West Allis.  Statements heard.  City of West Allis needs to have proof of ownership.  Petitioner Edward Topple called his witness on the telephone.  Witness MD sworn for testimony.  Testimony heard.  Court placed findings on the record and order return of Smith & Wesson and ammunition.  Order to be signed and filed.
Return of property hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Edward Charles Topple in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ENTRY MADE BY MK. On motion of the State for reasons on the record, court dismissed the case.

Defendant Edward Charles Topple in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Due to the lateness of the morning matter remains calendared in Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Charles Topple in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward Charles Topple appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Case adjourned for bail bond hearing,  final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Edward Charles Topple in court.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  Defendant made a request to set a speedy trial, though he is not in custody.
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/22 @ 2P
